one of three stages of cloud adoption the first is groups primarily
on-premises with large monolithic applications and they may have a few
small teams beginning to experiment with the cloud they typically have just hundreds of components the second phase
is where things start to get interesting we call this phase decentralized chaos because those first few groups have
multiplied across teams and departments and now everyone is migrating workloads to the cloud trying new tools and
implementing new processes with that decentralization comes duplication and lots of inefficiency there are typically
now thousands of components in the cloud at this stage now the third stage is what we call organized enablement this
is where cloud native companies are born but those having to journey here must first figure out how to manage their
tens of thousands or even hundreds of thousands of components and how to enable all of their teams they have to
figure out how to standardize their tools and centralize the governance and best practices now the efficiency and
